physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination was notable for pain on palpation of the epigastric area and tachycardia that resolved with intravenous fluids.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Tachycardia initially present resolved with treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Abdomen was nondistended with normal bowel sounds; tenderness on palpation of the right lower, right upper, and left upper quadrants without rebound or guarding; normal appearance of the anus; two nonbleeding external hemorrhoids.
